headline: WATCH: Highlights from Trump’s speech at North Carolina rally
author: DML News App
sentences:
Promoted Content
TRUMP: “You can take the 5 worst presidents in American history and put them together and they would not have done the damage Joe Biden has done to our country in just 15 months.”
— Benny (@bennyjohnson) April 9, 2022
“Our children are being indoctrinated, our values are being desecrated, our heritage is being obliterated, and our country is being humiliated by a president who has no idea what the hell is going on!” Trump said, as he began to rip into the Biden administration.

“We are going to end crazy Nancy Pelosi’s political career once and for all, she is crazy.”
Donald Trump speaks at a #SaveAmerica rally in Selma, North Carolina.#TrumpRally

“You can take the 5 worst presidents in American history and put them together and they would not have done the damage Joe Biden has done to our country in just 15 months,” Trump said.

President Trump vows to ‘demand justice for the Jan. 6 prisoners and full protection of their civil rights like was received by ANTIFA, Black Lives Matter who murdered people throughout our country.’ pic.twitter.com/I9VxV5zpjh
President Trump: ‘We must ensure that every election can be FULLY and quickly audited.’ pic.twitter.com/9sWhOHumo6
Trump confirmed his endorsement for Dr. Mehmet Oz, in Pennsylvania, who is running for U.S. Senate.

Trump vows to end ‘every last Covid mandate’ and pass legislation making it illegal for employers to fire workers for not having the vaccine pic.twitter.com/e2kMfDU99N
“While we’re at it, demand justice for the Jan. 6 prisoners and full protection of their civil rights like was received by ANTIFA, Black Lives Matter who murdered people throughout our country,” Trump said.

President Trump: “Our children are being indoctrinated, our values are being desecrated, our heritage is being obliterated, and our country is being humiliated by a president who has no idea what the hell is going on!” pic.twitter.com/nacgozhrRm
Trump blasted Biden for ending the Title 42 program, which allowed illegal aliens to be turned back across the border.

Promoted Content
“Seven months from now, the people from North Carolina are going to vote to fire the radical left Democrats… we’re going to elect an incredible slate of true America First Republicans… up and down the ballot you will go… and together we are going to end crazy Nancy Pelosi’s career once and for all.

We love Trump!”
Resounding “We Love Trump!” chants break out at North Carolina rally pic.twitter.com/6ph8kYRskd
Trump vowed that when Republicans win back the majority in 2022, they will end ‘every last Covid mandate’ and pass legislation making it illegal for employers to fire workers for not having the vaccine.

“”We had so much we would have been DOUBLE the size of Russia and Saudi Arabia put together in one year.”
President Trump touts energy independence: “We had so much we would have been DOUBLE the size of Russia and Saudi Arabia put together in one year.” pic.twitter.com/y2uj8cVFDA
“I ran twice.

‘MARK MY WORDS’: President Trump predicts America ‘will be paying a very big price’ for the ‘invasion’ at the border pic.twitter.com/lm6rvaTN6S
Trump said under his administration, America had energy independence.

“No country, I don’t care if it’s a third-world country, has ever had a worse border situation than us.”
Donald Trump slams President Joe Biden’s decision to end Title 42 immigration restrictions.

Blasting Biden’s open borders policies, Trump said it’s an invasion.

He added that Russia’s invasion of Ukraine would have never happened if he was still in the White House.
“We will be paying a very big price for this calamity, mark my words, for a long period of time.
Former President Donald Trump gave a fired-up speech in Selma, North Carolina Saturday evening.
“Biden is willfully opening the floodgates to a tidal wave of illegal immigration,” he said.
What’s coming into our country is going to leave a mark for many years,” he warned.
Trump held the rally in support of Ted Budd, who is running for U.S. Senate.
“Is there anybody here who would like to see me run again?” Trump asked.
I did much better the second time than I did the first.
And now, we may have to do it again,” Trump said.
